intro: Hieracium schreiteri, commonly known as the Schreiter's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disc and surrounding ray florets, and it blooms from June to August. Hieracium schreiteri is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
